l2MIB.name: l2MIB

revisions.description: Firmware release 3.0 introduces full rmon I and II. this enterprise mib is now obsolete.

l2MIB.contactinfo: Cabletron Systems, Inc. 35 Industrial Way, P.O. Box 5005 Rochester, NH 03867-0505 (603) 332-9400 support@ctron.com http://www.ctron.com
l2MIB.description: This module defines a schema to access SSR Layer 2 processing subsystem. This mib is no longer supported on ssr platforms. features of this mib now exist in standard mibs. RMON I RFC 1757 provides Layer 2 information and ctron-ssr-policy mib to program filter tables.

l2LearnedEntryDiscards.name: l2LearnedEntryDiscards
l2LearnedEntryDiscards.description: The total number of Forwarding Database entries, which have been or would have been learned, but have been discarded due to a lack of space to store them in the Forwarding Database. If this counter is increasing, it indicates that the Forwarding Database is regularly becoming full (a condition which has unpleasant performance effects on the subnetwork). If this counter has a significant value but is not presently increasing, it indicates that the problem has been occurring but is not persistent.

l2LearnedMacEntries.name: l2LearnedMacEntries
l2LearnedMacEntries.description: The total number of MAC entries. The total number is equal to the number of unique VLAN id and MAC address pairs on the switch.

l2LearnedFlowEntries.name: l2LearnedFlowEntries
l2LearnedFlowEntries.description: The total number of Flow entries. The total number is equal to the number of unique VLAN id, source MAC address and destination MAC address 3-tuple on the switch.

l2ForwardTable.name: l2ForwardTable
l2ForwardTable.description: A list of L2 flow entries.

l2ForwardEntry.name: l2ForwardEntry
l2ForwardEntry.description: An entry containing the L2 flow

l2ForwardFilterId.name: l2ForwardFilterId
l2ForwardFilterId.description: A filter number which is used to get the next row from the L2 Forwarding table. A zero implies no filter. When a number is used, the index(s) specified in the first GET_NEXT is used as a filter for future GET_NEXT's using the same FilterId.

l2ForwardDstMacAddr.name: l2ForwardDstMacAddr
l2ForwardDstMacAddr.description: The destination MAC address which has been learned.

l2ForwardSrcMacAddr.name: l2ForwardSrcMacAddr
l2ForwardSrcMacAddr.description: The source MAC address, which is present in case of a Flow, that has been learned by the switch.

l2ForwardVlanId.name: l2ForwardVlanId
l2ForwardVlanId.description: The VLAN the destination MAC address belongs to.

l2ForwardDstPort.name: l2ForwardDstPort
l2ForwardDstPort.description: The physical port number in the shelf/Chassis to which the frame will be forwarded. A zero implies that the frame destined to this destination MAC address will be forwarded to multiple ports. This implies a Multicast or unknown Unicast frame.

l2ForwardInPorts.name: l2ForwardInPorts
l2ForwardInPorts.description: The set of physical ports to which this entry is contained in the L2 tables. Each octet within the value of this object specifies a set of eight ports. The first octet specifying ports 1 through 8, the second octet specifying ports 9 through 16, etc. Within each octet, the least significant bit represents the lowest numbered port and the most significant bit represents the highest numbered port. Thus, each port of the bridge is represented by a single bit within the value of this object. If that bit has a value of '1' then that port is included in the set of ports; the port is not included if its bit has a value of '0'. (Note that the setting of the bit corresponding to the port from which a frame is received is irrelevant.) The default value of this object is a string of zeroes of appropriate length. The maximum number of ports/card-module is sysHwModuleNumPorts.

l2PriorityTable.name: l2PriorityTable
l2PriorityTable.description: A list of L2 flow entries.

l2PriorityEntry.name: l2PriorityEntry
l2PriorityEntry.description: An entry containing the L2 flow.

l2PriorityIndex.name: l2PriorityIndex
l2PriorityIndex.description: A unique index into the L2 priority table.

l2PriorityDesc.name: l2PriorityDesc
l2PriorityDesc.description: A string used to identify the flow by name.

l2PriorityDstMacAddr.name: l2PriorityDstMacAddr
l2PriorityDstMacAddr.description: The destination MAC address which has been learned.

l2PrioritySrcMacAddr.name: l2PrioritySrcMacAddr
l2PrioritySrcMacAddr.description: The source MAC address, which is present in case of a Flow, that has been learned by the switch.

l2PriorityVlanId.name: l2PriorityVlanId
l2PriorityVlanId.description: The VLAN the destination MAC address belongs to.

l2PriorityInPorts.name: l2PriorityInPorts
l2PriorityInPorts.description: The set of physical ports which allow this source MAC address. Each octet within the value of this object specifies a set of eight ports, with the first octet specifying ports 1 through 8, the second octet specifying ports 9 through 16, etc. Within each octet, the least significant bit represents the lowest numbered port, and the most significant bit represents the highest numbered port. Thus, each port of the bridge is represented by a single bit within the value of this object. If that bit has a value of '1' then that port is included in the set of ports; the port is not included if its bit has a value of '0'. (Note that the setting of the bit corresponding to the port from which a frame is received is irrelevant.) The default value of this object is a string of zeroes of appropriate length. The maximum number of ports per Module/Card is sysHwModuleNumPorts.

l2Priority.name: l2Priority
l2Priority.description: The priority for this L2 flow. There are four priority levels: low, medium, high and control. The highest priority class is reserved for router control traffic, which leaves three classes, high, medium, and low for normal data flows. Buffered traffic in higher priority classes is sent ahead of pending traffic in lower priority classes, which allows latency and throughput demands to be maintained for the higher priority traffic. To prevent low priority traffic from waiting indefinitely as higher priority traffic fills the wire, a weighted fair queuing mechanism provides adjustable minimum bandwidth guarantees at each output port, thereby ensuring that some traffic from each priority class always gets through.

l2FilterEntry.name: l2FilterEntry
l2FilterEntry.description: An entry containing the L2 filter.

l2FilterIndex.name: l2FilterIndex
l2FilterIndex.description: A unique index into the table.

l2FilterDesc.name: l2FilterDesc
l2FilterDesc.description: A string used to identify the filter by an name.

l2FilterType.name: l2FilterType
l2FilterType.description: The types of filters, as explained below. static-entry Based on the restrictions and the presence of source, destination MAC address they can be of three types : source-static-entry - All frames with a source address equal to srcMAC, coming through any of the inPorts will be allowed/disallowed to go to any port that is a member of the outPorts list. destination-static-entry - All frames with a destination address equal to dstMAC, coming through any of the inPorts will be allowed/ disallowed/forced to go to any port that is a member of the outPorts list. flow-static-entry - All frames with a source address equal to srcMAC and a destination address equal to dstMAC, coming through any of the inPorts list will be allowed/disallowed to go to any port that is a member of the outPorts list. address-filter Based on the restrictions and the presence of source, destination MAC address they can be of three types : source-address-filter - All frames with a source address equal to srcMAC, coming through any of the inPorts will be filtered out. destination-address-filter - All frames with a destination address equal to dstMAC, coming through any of the inPorts will be filtered out. flow-filter - All frames with a source address equal to srcMAC and a destination address equal to dstMAC, coming through any of the inPorts list will be filtered out. address-lock This locks a source address to a port. It allows learning of srcMAC addresses only on any of the ports in inPorts.

l2FilterRestrictions.name: l2FilterRestrictions
l2FilterRestrictions.description: The restrictions which are applied when the filterType is static-entry.

l2FilterSrcMacAddr.name: l2FilterSrcMacAddr
l2FilterSrcMacAddr.description: The source MAC address, which is present in case of a Flow, that has been learned by the switch.

l2FilterDstMacAddr.name: l2FilterDstMacAddr
l2FilterDstMacAddr.description: The destination MAC address which has been learned.

l2FilterVlanId.name: l2FilterVlanId
l2FilterVlanId.description: The VLAN the destination MAC address belongs to.

l2FilterInPorts.name: l2FilterInPorts
l2FilterInPorts.description: The set of physical ports which allow this source MAC address. Each octet within the value of this object specifies a set of eight ports, with the first octet specifying ports 1 through 8, the second octet specifying ports 9 through 16, etc. Within each octet, the least significant bit represents the lowest numbered port, and the most significant bit represents the highest numbered port. Thus, each port of the bridge is represented by a single bit within the value of this object. If that bit has a value of '1' then that port is included in the set of ports; the port is not included if its bit has a value of '0'. (Note that the setting of the bit corresponding to the port from which a frame is received is irrelevant.) The default value of this object is a string of zeroes of appropriate length. The maximum number of ports/card-module is sysHwModuleNumPorts.

l2FilterOutPorts.name: l2FilterOutPorts
l2FilterOutPorts.description: The set of ports which allow this destination MAC address. Each octet within the value of this object specifies a set of eight ports, with the first octet specifying ports 1 through 8, the second octet specifying ports 9 through 16, etc. Within each octet, the most significant bit represents the lowest numbered port, and the least significant bit represents the highest numbered port. Thus, each port of the bridge is represented by a single bit within the value of this object. If that bit has a value of '1' then that port is included in the set of ports; the port is not included if its bit has a value of '0'. (Note that the setting of the bit corresponding to the port from which a frame is received is irrelevant.) The default value of this object is a string of zeroes of appropriate length.

l2PortSecurityTable.name: l2PortSecurityTable
l2PortSecurityTable.description: A list of L2 port security filters.

l2PortSecurityEntry.name: l2PortSecurityEntry
l2PortSecurityEntry.description: An entry containing the L2 filter.

l2PortSecurityIndex.name: l2PortSecurityIndex
l2PortSecurityIndex.description: A unique index into the table.

l2PortSecurityDesc.name: l2PortSecurityDesc
l2PortSecurityDesc.description: A string used to identify the filter by a name.

l2PortSecurityType.name: l2PortSecurityType
l2PortSecurityType.description: The security filters are of two types : source-secure For all the ports in inPorts forward only those frames that match source-static-entry filter from the l2FilterTable. destination-secure For all the ports in inPorts forward only those frames that match destination-static-entry filter from the l2FilterTable.

l2PortSecurityVlanId.name: l2PortSecurityVlanId
l2PortSecurityVlanId.description: The VLAN the destination MAC address belongs to.

l2PortSecurityInPorts.name: l2PortSecurityInPorts
l2PortSecurityInPorts.description: The set of physical ports which allow this source MAC address. Each octet within the value of this object specifies a set of eight ports, with the first octet specifying ports 1 through 8, the second octet specifying ports 9 through 16, etc. Within each octet, the least significant bit represents the lowest numbered port, and the most significant bit represents the highest numbered port. Thus, each port of the bridge is represented by a single bit within the value of this object. If that bit has a value of '1' then that port is included in the set of ports; the port is not included if its bit has a value of '0'. (Note that the setting of the bit corresponding to the port from which a frame is received is irrelevant.) The default value of this object is a string of zeroes of appropriate length.

l2PortTable.name: l2PortTable
l2PortTable.description: A table that contains information about every physical port that is associated with this transparent bridge.

l2PortEntry.name: l2PortEntry
l2PortEntry.description: A list of information for each physical port.

l2Port.name: l2Port
l2Port.description: The port number of the port for which this entry contains Transparent bridging management information.

l2PortAgingStatus.name: l2PortAgingStatus
l2PortAgingStatus.description: Whether aging is enabled or not on this port.

l2PortAgingTime.name: l2PortAgingTime
l2PortAgingTime.description: The time-out period in seconds for aging out dynamically learned forwarding information. 802.1D-1990 recommends a default of 300 seconds.

l2PortDemandAgeHiBound.name: l2PortDemandAgeHiBound
l2PortDemandAgeHiBound.description: When the number of MAC entries on a physical port's L2 table reaches the l2PortDemandAgeHiBound (95% full), a number of MAC entries based on l2PortDemandAgeLowBound percentage will be removed (aged-out) from the table.

l2PortDemandAgeLowBound.name: l2PortDemandAgeLowBound
l2PortDemandAgeLowBound.description: The l2PortDemandAgeLowBound value determines how many MAC entries need to be aged-out. See l2PortDemandAgeHiBound. Default value is 85%. Example: if - L2 table capacity = 10,000 entries - l2PortDemandAgeHiBound = 95% - l2PortDemandAgeLowBound = 85% When the L2 table reaches 95% capacity (9500 MAC entries), 10% of the entries will be aged-out.

l2PortDemandAgeCount.name: l2PortDemandAgeCount
l2PortDemandAgeCount.description: The number of times demand aging has taken place on this physical port.

l2PortLearnedEntryDiscards.name: l2PortLearnedEntryDiscards
l2PortLearnedEntryDiscards.description: The total number of L2 Port table entries, which have been or would have been learned, but have been discarded due to a lack of space to store them in the Forwarding Database. If this counter is increasing, it indicates that the L2 port table is regularly becoming full (a condition which has unpleasant performance effects on the subnetwork). If this counter has a significant value but is not presently increasing, it indicates that the problem has been occurring but is not persistent.

l2PortSrcEntries.name: l2PortSrcEntries
l2PortSrcEntries.description: The number of MAC addresses/Flow entries that reside on this ports L2 table as a source (i.e. for a flow entry the source and destination MAC address's lie on the same LAN segment).

l2PortDstEntries.name: l2PortDstEntries
l2PortDstEntries.description: The number of MAC addresses/Flow entries that reside on this ports L2 table as a destination (i.e. for a flow entry the destination MAC address was not learned as a source).

l2PortMgmtEntries.name: l2PortMgmtEntries
l2PortMgmtEntries.description: The number of user configured entries, including filters, bridge management addresses etc.

l2PortMaxInfo.name: l2PortMaxInfo
l2PortMaxInfo.description: The maximum size of the info/data (non-MAC) field that this port will receive or transmit. See RFC 1493 for similar OID called dot1dTpPortMaxInfo.

l2PortInFrames.name: l2PortInFrames
l2PortInFrames.description: The number of frames that have been received by this port from its segment. Note that a frame received on the interface corresponding to this port is only counted by this object if and only if it is for a protocol being processed by the local bridging function, including bridge management frames.

l2PortOutFrames.name: l2PortOutFrames
l2PortOutFrames.description: The number of frames that have been transmitted by this port to its segment. Note that a frame transmitted on the interface corresponding to this port is only counted by this object if and only if it is for a protocol being processed by the local bridging function, including bridge management frames.

l2PortForwardTable.name: l2PortForwardTable
l2PortForwardTable.description: A table that contains information about the Forward/Flow Table that is associated with this port.

l2PortForwardEntry.name: l2PortForwardEntry
l2PortForwardEntry.description: A list of Flow/Forward information for this port.

l2PortForwardPort.name: l2PortForwardPort
l2PortForwardPort.description: The port number of the port for which this entry contains Transparent bridging management information.

l2PortForwardIndex.name: l2PortForwardIndex
l2PortForwardIndex.description: A unique index into the Flow/Forward database table.

l2PortForwardDstMacAddr.name: l2PortForwardDstMacAddr
l2PortForwardDstMacAddr.description: The destination MAC address which has been learned.

l2PortForwardSrcMacAddr.name: l2PortForwardSrcMacAddr
l2PortForwardSrcMacAddr.description: The source MAC address, which is present in case of a Flow, that has been learned by the switch.

l2PortForwardVlanId.name: l2PortForwardVlanId
l2PortForwardVlanId.description: The VLAN the destination MAC address belongs to.

l2PortForwardDstPort.name: l2PortForwardDstPort
l2PortForwardDstPort.description: The physical port number to which the frame will be forwarded. A zero implies that the frame destined to this destination MAC address will be forwarded to multiple ports. This implies a Multicast or unknown Unicast frame.

l2PortForwardStatus.name: l2PortForwardStatus
l2PortForwardStatus.description: The status of this entry. The meanings of the values are: other(1) : none of the following. This would include the case where some other MIB object (not the corresponding instance of dot1dTpFdbPort, nor an entry in the dot1dStaticTable) is being used to determine if and how frames addressed to the value of the corresponding instance of dot1dTpFdbAddress are being forwarded. invalid(2) : this entry is not longer valid (e.g., it was learned but has since aged-out), but has not yet been flushed from the table. learned(3) : the value of the corresponding instance of dot1dTpFdbPort was learned, and is being used. self(4) : the value of the corresponding instance of dot1dTpFdbAddress represents one of the bridge's addresses. The corresponding instance of dot1dTpFdbPort indicates which of the bridge's ports has this address. mgmt(5) : the value of the corresponding instance of dot1dTpFdbAddress is also the value of an existing instance of dot1dStaticAddress.

l2PortForwardLastDetectedTime.name: l2PortForwardLastDetectedTime
l2PortForwardLastDetectedTime.description: The time (in hundredths of a second) since the last time this MAC address was detected by this port.

l2ComplianceV10.name: l2ComplianceV10
l2ComplianceV10.description: The compliance statement for the SSR-L2-MIB.

l2ConfGroupV10.name: l2ConfGroupV10
l2ConfGroupV10.description: A set of managed objects that make up version 1.0 of the SSR Layer 2 mib.
